                    ### Question

                    ### Options
                    opa. It is more common with huminsulin

(opb) Infections can lead to an inflammatory response, which is known to increase insulin resistance, supported by evidence linking inflammation to insulin resistance. (opc) The presence of antibodies to insulin can bind to insulin, reducing its effectiveness and thereby increasing insulin resistance. (opd) The use of glucocorticoids is not advisable in managing insulin resistance as they typically increase blood glucose levels and worsen insulin resistance. Therefore, the statement that glucocorticoids may be useful in severe cases is incorrect.
